name: Command-Line To-Do List App
description: A beginner-level project that teaches Python fundamentals through a text-based to-do list using file storage and menu-based navigation.

steps.title: Set Up Project File
steps.description: Create a file named `todo.py` and add a welcome message.

code.snippet: print("Welcome to Your CLI To-Do List App")

steps.title: Design Menu Interface
steps.description: Add a function to print a menu with user options.

code.snippet:
def show_menu():
    print("\nMenu Options:")
    print("1. View Tasks")
    print("2. Add Task")
    print("3. Remove Task")
    print("4. Clear All Tasks")
    print("5. Exit")

steps.title: Handle File Reading
steps.description: Create a function to load tasks from a text file if it exists.

steps.title: Handle File Writing
steps.description: Create a function to save the updated list of tasks to the file.

steps.title: Display Task List
steps.description: Show the user the current tasks with indices for reference.

steps.title: Add New Task
steps.description: Prompt the user to enter a task and append it to the list.

steps.title: Remove a Task by Number
steps.description: Let the user delete a task using its displayed number.

steps.title: Clear All Tasks
steps.description: Warn the user before removing all tasks.

steps.title: Put Everything in a Loop
steps.description: Create a main function to run the menu in a continuous loop.

name: Random Quote Generator
description: A beginner-friendly React app that fetches random quotes from an API and displays them with styling and interactive functionality.

steps.title: Initialize React Project
steps.description: Use Create React App to set up your development environment. This gives you a full React boilerplate with zero config.

code.snippet:
npx create-react-app quote-generator
cd quote-generator
npm start

steps.title: Clean Up Default Files
steps.description: Remove unused files like logo.svg, App.test.js, and default content in App.css and App.js so you can start with a clean slate.

steps.title: Create a QuoteBox Component
steps.description: Create a new file `QuoteBox.js` to hold the quote, author, and button. We use props to pass data into this component.

steps.title: Import the QuoteBox into App.js
steps.description: Bring the QuoteBox into App.js and prepare to pass it the state it needs.

steps.title: Use useEffect to Load First Quote Automatically
steps.description: Use `useEffect` to automatically fetch a quote when the app loads. This prevents the user from seeing a blank screen.

steps.title: Style the App with CSS
steps.description: Make the quote box centered, add spacing, and apply nice fonts and colors.

steps.title: Test the Application
steps.description: Click the 'New Quote' button to see if quotes change. Check that your app fetches data correctly and handles errors gracefully.

name: Task Manager App
description: A full-featured task manager app where users can register, log in, and manage their to-do list.

steps.title: Set up the React App
steps.description: Use Create React App or Vite to initialize your frontend. Install Axios and React Router.

code.snippet:
npx create-react-app client
cd client
npm install axios react-router-dom

steps.title: Create Basic Pages and Routing
steps.description: Set up routes for Home, Register, Login, and Dashboard.

code.snippet:
<Routes>
  <Route path="/" element={<Home />} />
  <Route path="/login" element={<Login />} />
  <Route path="/register" element={<Register />} />
  <Route path="/dashboard" element={<Dashboard />} />
</Routes>

steps.title: Build Auth Forms
steps.description: Create forms for user registration and login that send POST requests to the backend.

code.snippet: axios.post('/api/auth/register', { username, email, password })

steps.title: Initialize Express Server
steps.description: Create a new Node.js project, install dependencies, and create your Express server.

steps.title: Connect MongoDB
steps.description: Use Mongoose to connect to a MongoDB Atlas instance.

code.snippet: mongoose.connect(process.env.MONGO_URI)

steps.title: Create User & Task Models
steps.description: Define Mongoose schemas for users and tasks.

code.snippet: const UserSchema = new mongoose.Schema({ email: String, password: String })

steps.title: Build Authentication API
steps.description: Implement user registration and login routes with JWT support.

code.snippet: jwt.sign({ id: user._id }, process.env.JWT_SECRET)

steps.title: Implement Protected Task Routes
steps.description: Use JWT middleware to restrict access to task creation and retrieval routes.

code.snippet: const token = req.header('Authorization').split(' ')[1]; jwt.verify(token, secret)

steps.title: Build Task Manager UI
steps.description: Create components to add, delete, and complete tasks. Fetch tasks from the backend.

code.snippet: useEffect(() => { axios.get('/api/tasks') }, [])
